segment_text: Well, I was at work one day
I was doing my usual job
working on the warehouse floor
stocking boxes
organizing merchandise
I had been working for a few hours
it was getting late
I had been feeling a bit strange
a bit lightheaded
but chalked it up to hunger
not having eaten yet that day
But then, as I was walking around the warehouse
returning items to their proper places
I started to feel a strange tightness
and pressure in my chest
I stopped what I was doing
leaned against a nearby wall for a bit
the pressure only got stronger
I could feel my heart pounding in my chest
Next thing I know, I started seeing spots
I could feel sweat dripping down my forehead
my arms
I tried to take some deep breaths
I just couldn't catch my breath
I was really scared
didn't know what to do.
Suddenly I heard a voice coming from across the warehouse.
It was the manager
who had seen me
called out to me
it seems someone had noticed me
was checking to see if I was alright
I tried to yell back that something was wrong
I couldn't find my voice.
The manager started walking towards me
I could feel my world going dark
I started to drop to the ground
luckily the manager got to me in time
caught me just before my legs gave out
He took me to the staff room
sat me down in a chair
He asked me questions about what was wrong
what happened
He got me a glass of cold water
told me to rest for a bit
After a few minutes
the pressure in my chest slowly eased up
I started to feel better
It turned out I had been having a panic attack
I escaped from the situation
the help of the quick action of the manager
It was never a fun experience
it really could have been much worse
it taught me to check in with myself
make sure to properly rest
eat to avoid further episodes
